messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion]plastic grocery bags
messages.msgSnippet: ... Our co-op doesn t buy any bags, and all the bags they use are collected previously-used plastic bags from other stores.... Dana in Montana
messages.messageBody:
> Walmart has a cardboard bin thing at both entrances
> to the store to
> recycle/collect used plastic grocery bags.
>
> We save ours and use them over and over again, or I
> recycle them at Walmart.

Our co-op doesn't buy any bags, and all the bags they
use are collected previously-used plastic bags from
other stores....
Dana
in Montana

messages.subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion]plastic grocery bags
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/2004 12:59:35 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... But we visited a recycling company and they said they didn t bother to recycle them because
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/2004 12:59:35 PM Eastern Standard Time,
pamsoroosh@... writes:
>>Plastic grocery bags can be recycled - are collected for that purpose.
But we visited a recycling company and they said they didn't bother to
recycle them because they couldn't get any money for them - there is
such a huge "supply" that the price is zero. So they go into landfills
with all the other trash.<<
***************************
Walmart has a cardboard bin thing at both entrances to the store to
recycle/collect used plastic grocery bags.

We save ours and use them over and over again, or I recycle them at Walmart.

Nancy B.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
